Class UserInteraction

  • java.lang.Object
    • UserInteraction
  • public class UserInteraction
extends java.lang.Object
    UserInteraction class represent the interaction with the user, accepts all the inputs to manage the actions the program has to do and implements the GUI.
    Since:
    05 - December - 2020
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Theodora-Sofia Tsochataridou, Maria Paikou

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      (package private) class  UserInteraction.MyKeyListener
      KeyListener stores the answer(s) from the keyboard and after checking their validness sets changes the status of the player(s) if needed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void announcingCategory()
      Informs the player what the category of the upcoming question is.
      void announcingTheType()
      Selects a random type and announces it to the users.
      void askTheQuestion()
      This method displays the question accompanied by the four possible answers and an image if necessary.
      private void basicDisplay()
      This is the first window to appear when the user starts the game.
      void betPoints()
      If the type for the round is Bet, then before asking the question and after announcing the category, this method requests the player to make a bet, choosing between 250, 500, 750 and 1000 points.
      void betPoints2()
      In case there are two players, this method is used to accept the second player's bet.
      void correctAnswer()
      This function prints the correct answer to the question asked previously.
      void finalScore()
      finalScores shows the score that the player in one-player mode has when the game ends.
      void God​(int numberOfPlayers)
      Function God asks the user to insert a nickname and then creates a player object with that input.
      private void God2()
      This method is used in two-player mode and has the same functionality as God.
      void HowManyOfYou()
      Asks the user to select the number of players.
      void LetsGo()
      Let's go was added for dramatic effect but is not useless as it randomizes the questions before the actual game begins.
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main method creates a UserInteraction object, which contains all the graphics for the game and calls the first method.
      void questionNumber()
      Displays the number of the question will be asked (there is a default number in a round) and selects a question from the randomized database.
      void replay()
      Asks the user if they want to play again and initializes all the objects used in the game in order to prepare for a new game.
      void roundNumber()
      Shows to the user which round is the round that is about to start.
      private void setLabelFeatures​(javax.swing.JLabel text)  
      private void showHighScores()
      Displays the contents of the high score file, which are the ten highest scores in one player mode.
      void showScores()
      This method informs the player(s) about the accuracy of their answer and displays the current score situation.
      private void showTotalWins()
      Displays the game scores of previous multiplayer games.
      void winner()
      Announces the winner of the two-player game accompanied by the final score.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserInteraction

        public UserInteraction()

    • Method Detail

      • basicDisplay

        private void basicDisplay()
        This is the first window to appear when the user starts the game. It displays the name of the game and has three buttons, a start button that starts the game and buttons for the saved scores and previous game scores.

      • showHighScores

        private void showHighScores()
        Displays the contents of the high score file, which are the ten highest scores in one player mode.

      • showTotalWins

        private void showTotalWins()
        Displays the game scores of previous multiplayer games.

      • HowManyOfYou

        public void HowManyOfYou()
        Asks the user to select the number of players. There are two choices: 1 Player and 2 Players.

      • God

        public void God​(int numberOfPlayers)
        Function God asks the user to insert a nickname and then creates a player object with that input.
        Parameters:
        numberOfPlayers - the number of players in this game

      • God2

        private void God2()
        This method is used in two-player mode and has the same functionality as God.

      • LetsGo

        public void LetsGo()
        Let's go was added for dramatic effect but is not useless as it randomizes the questions before the actual game begins.

      • setLabelFeatures

        private void setLabelFeatures​(javax.swing.JLabel text)

      • roundNumber

        public void roundNumber()
        Shows to the user which round is the round that is about to start.

      • announcingTheType

        public void announcingTheType()
        Selects a random type and announces it to the users.

      • questionNumber

        public void questionNumber()
        Displays the number of the question will be asked (there is a default number in a round) and selects a question from the randomized database.

      • announcingCategory

        public void announcingCategory()
        Informs the player what the category of the upcoming question is.

      • betPoints

        public void betPoints()
        If the type for the round is Bet, then before asking the question and after announcing the category, this method requests the player to make a bet, choosing between 250, 500, 750 and 1000 points.

      • betPoints2

        public void betPoints2()
        In case there are two players, this method is used to accept the second player's bet.

      • askTheQuestion

        public void askTheQuestion()
        This method displays the question accompanied by the four possible answers and an image if necessary. It also implements a key listener in order to receive the answer of the user(s).

      • correctAnswer

        public void correctAnswer()
        This function prints the correct answer to the question asked previously.

      • showScores

        public void showScores()
        This method informs the player(s) about the accuracy of their answer and displays the current score situation.

      • finalScore

        public void finalScore()
        finalScores shows the score that the player in one-player mode has when the game ends.

      • winner

        public void winner()
        Announces the winner of the two-player game accompanied by the final score.

      • replay

        public void replay()
        Asks the user if they want to play again and initializes all the objects used in the game in order to prepare for a new game.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method creates a UserInteraction object, which contains all the graphics for the game and calls the first method.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments for the main method
